title: Circular economy solution gives electric vehicle batteries a second life - Cordis News
summary: The EU-funded TREASoURcE project is demonstrating the use of second-life electric vehicle batteries in stationary battery energy storage systems (BESS) at two sites in Norway and Finland. This project showcases the potential for circular economy solutions in addressing the environmental impact of battery production and disposal.

title: How a circular economy would lead to EU energy savings - The Brussels Times
summary: A new report from the Materials & Products Taskforce of the European Corporate Leaders Group (CLG Europe) highlights the importance of a circular economy for reducing energy consumption in the European Union. The report showcases examples of leading businesses that are already implementing circular economy strategies, such as Saint-Gobain's 'Glass Forever roadmap' which recycles glass and uses less energy compared to virgin materials, and ROCKWOOL's closed-loop recycling system for stone wool insulation materials. The report also makes recommendations for policymakers on how to promote circularity through existing policies, including creating a clearer vision for a green industrial strategy and supporting the development of recycling technologies.

title: Environmentalists Seek End to Plastic Industry “Hoax” – Mother Jones - Mother Jones
summary: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is reviewing its Green Guides, which govern environmental advertising and labeling claims, with a focus on plastic recycling. Environmental groups argue that advanced or chemical recycling, touted as a circular solution, is essentially greenwashing, involving energy-intensive processes with a high carbon footprint and producing only a small amount of usable materials. The FTC's decision could significantly influence the growth of advanced recycling technologies, including pyrolysis, while the EPA also explores regulating the process due to concerns about environmental risks.

greenwashing: The chemical recycling process, with its high energy consumption and limited conversion of waste to usable materials, potentially constitutes greenwashing as it may exaggerate the environmental benefits of the process.

title: Sustainable side-stream management in Swedish food processing companies using external actors and biogas solutions - Frontiers
summary: This article investigates how food processing companies manage their side-streams, focusing on the role of biogas solutions in sustainability strategies. The study finds that most companies prefer outsourcing side-stream management to external actors, particularly for lower-value solutions, while those with long-term sustainability goals are more likely to invest in internal technologies like biogas production. Biogas solutions are seen as a versatile option for managing diverse types of side-streams, offering both energy recovery and nutrient recycling benefits.
